results.title: The Brotherhood of St Laurence
results.creator_credit: Brotherhood of St Lawrence Production Co
results.brief_description: The Brotherhood, which is based in Melbourne, works for a better deal for disadvantaged people. This documentary describes the Brotherhood’s beginnings; its current welfare services, including accommodation for older people, a material aid service, and a sheltered workshop; its support for other independent groups; and its involvement in social issues.

results.title: Golden summers: the Heidelberg school
results.creator_credit: Peter Purvis, Peter Bramley and National Gallery of Victoria
results.brief_description: Golden Summers covers the most celebrated period in the history of Australian art, the years from 1885 until shortly after the turn of the century. The artists at the time were Tom Roberts, Arthur Streeton, Charles Conder and Fred McCubbin, popularly known as the Heidelberg School, and they believed that it was their task to paint Australian realities. Narrated by Patrick McCaughey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Purvis, Peter Bramley and National Gallery of Victoria

results.title: Eager to Write (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, W Buckland F'tion, L Reichstein F'tion and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: For children, the process of learning to write is a gradual and experimental one. This program follows the progress of children of different ages in the classroom. Follows a Myer Foundation program at Moonee Ponds West Primary School with Lorraine Wilson.

results.title: The Devil's toy
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The skateboard gave the youngsters, who mastered its technique, a thrilling sensation of speed unexcelled by any other pavement sport. Filmed in 1966 on Montreal streets before the elongated rollerskate was banned, this film captures the exuberance of boys and girls having the time of their lives in free-wheeling downhill locomotion. Music by Pierre Brault. Sung by Genevieve Bujold.

results.title: Computers as work aids in transport; Impact of computers in local government
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
A compilation of two programs which examine the role of computers at work: 1. Computers as work aids in transport (16 min). - 2. Impact of computers in local government (16 min).

results.title: Crikey There's a Tractor On the Farm
results.creator_credit: Robert Grant, Stephen Mepham and Comedia Productions
results.brief_description: An entertaining look at the need for safety precautions with farm tractors including the use of seatbelts and ear muffs. Written by Robert Grant. Cast: Maurie Fields, Simon Thorpe.
